topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Add New Scale-out Proxy Node

othermeta.name: role
othermeta.content: Keshava HPE Binamra S, Paul F

body.p: This topic shows how to add a proxy node to the store account and container ring.

li.xref: Copy (essential) ring files to proxy node
Update load balancer with new proxy nodes

ul.li:
HPE Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.
(Starter Object Sotrage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)

section.title: Deploying new node(s)
section.p: Perform the steps mentioned in Provision Node(s) to deploy a new node.

section.title: Copy (essential) ring files to proxy node
section.p: Perform the following steps to copy the required ring files to a proxy node:

ol.li: Log in to the undercloud from seed.# ssh heat-admin@<undercloud IP address> # sudo -i
Change the directory to ring builder.# cd /root/ring-building

Copy account, container, object, and generated object-1.ring.gz files to proxy nodes and press yes when asked to authenticate the node.# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/\*.ring.gz -n <proxy node IP address>

Copy object-1.builder files to proxy nodes.# ringos copy-ring -s /root/ring-building/object-1.builder -n <proxy node IP address>
The .buldier and .ring.gz files must be present in the Swift nodes.

section.title: Update load balancer with new proxy nodes

ol.li: After creation of the Proxy node, list the Proxy IP addresses.# ringos list-swift-nodes -t proxy
List all the controller nodes# nova list
Edit swift-proxy.cfg on each of the controller nodes./etc/haproxy/manual/swift-proxy.cfg

Add the following content in the swift-proxy.cfg file. listen scale_swift_proxy bind <Virtual IP (running on the controller nodes)>:8080 server <proxy node hostname> <proxy nodes IP address>:8080 check inter 2000 rise 2 fall 5
The number of "server" lines equals the number of Swift Proxies you have set up.
For virtual IP:
Login to the controller node # ssh heat-admin@<Controller Node IP address> # sudo -i
Run the following command to view the virtual IP of the controller nodes vi /etc/keepalived/keepalived.conf
Restart the HA Proxy service on all these nodes.# service haproxy restart

section.p: The Swift Proxies are now successfully enabled with HA Proxy.

p.note: You now must add account and container rings to the Swift Proxies. For these instructions, go to Adding disk account containers.
